scenarioDescription:
The HD 100655 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 100655 is a star with 2.28 times the mass of the Sun, and 10.06 times its radius. It is located 447.41 light years away from the solar system.

HD 100655 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 100655 system


HD 100655 b

HD 100655 b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory, in 2012-04, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.68 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 100655 b is 511.980 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 100655 b is 13.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 100655 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 100655, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
name: HD 100655 - System With 1 Exoplanet
